image.altText: A composite image of Dean Winter looking serious and David O'Byrne looking happy

props.synopsis: More seats have been confirmed as vote counting continues following the Tasmanian state election. Former Labor leader, now independent David O'Byrne has finished ahead of current leader Dean Winter, and Liberals Simon Behrakis and Nic Street have lost their seats.

title.children: Former Labor leader finishes ahead of current leader in Tasmanian election

image.altText: Two students hold dusters to erase crosses on a board

props.synopsis: After 17 years of NAPLAN testing, Australia is yet to see a big turnaround in results — so what can be done to improve them?

title.children: 'Postcode, privilege' — not education system — shaping 'opportunity'

image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff says he intends to approve the Marinus Link interconnector deal with the federal government, as he seeks final advice. A business case has not been released, and negotiations continued during the caretaker period.

title.children: Marinus business case 'older news', premier says, as deal details start to emerge

image.altText: A small wood heater with fire wood

props.synopsis: A new generation of low-emission wood heaters that produce a fraction of the particulate pollution of current models could save lives by improving air quality, researchers say.

title.children: Why Australia hasn't adopted NZ's solution to wood smoke pollution

image.altText: A group of greyhounds run as one in a pink jersey falls backwards.

props.synopsis: Champion greyhound Raider's Guide died following a race fall in Launceston on Monday night, prompting renewed calls to shut down the industry in Tasmania.

title.children: Renewed calls to end greyhound racing in Tasmania, following champion's death

image.altText: Black and white image of man and woman standing in front of advertisement on car reads "Delishus"

props.synopsis: When Ursula Wuttke began selling hot, jam donuts from her shop in Tasmania in the 1960s, the response was "crazy". Her culinary legacy is just one aspect of the almost 100-year-old's life story.

title.children: Woman who fled war-torn Europe reflects on her Aussie culinary legacy

image.altText: Man sits at cafe with coffee, smiling for photo.

props.synopsis: Giving his first speech in the Senate, Tasmanian Labor's Josh Dolega tells young queer people: "I hope you know that you're seen, that you're understood and you are represented."

title.children: First openly gay Tasmanian Labor Senator reflects on responsibility

image.altText: An old man with a mask and scarf, two young women and another gentlemen with a face covering walk into a court building.

props.synopsis: A court hears a former high school student made a secret recording of an alleged inappropriate conversation with a teacher and later played it to the school's then-principal — who declined to take any action.

title.children: Witness secretly recorded former Hobart teacher, court hears

image.altText: An Indigenous man in traditional body paint dances.

props.synopsis: From the pain of a broken political promise and one community’s desire to push forward, the Garma festival was born.

title.children: The broken promise that has loomed over 25 years of Garma

image.altText: Primary school children using pencils in class

props.synopsis: Artarmon man David James was charged by Australian Federal Police with more than a dozen offences, including 10 counts of using a child under the age of 14 to make child abuse material.

title.children: Alleged paedophile worked at 58 out-of-school-hours care centres in Sydney

image.altText: A drone shot of rows of houses in Shell Cove, Wollongong's south.

props.synopsis: Australian property prices have scaled new record highs as demand for housing offsets buyer concerns about the Reserve Bank's shock call to hold interest rates steady.

title.children: Home price climb continues despite interest rate pause

image.altText: FBI director Kash Patel is wearing a suit and is amongst other smartly dressed people

props.synopsis: Kash Patel, who is a loyalist of US President Donald Trump, quietly stopped in Sydney before travelling to New Zealand to announce the United States would expand its FBI office in Wellington.

title.children: Home Affairs minister met with FBI director during secretive Australia visit

image.altText: Conor McGregor in a blue suit and tie looking emotionless down at the ground while walking in front of a black turnstile gate

props.synopsis: Former mixed martial arts fighter Conor McGregor has lost his attempt to overturn a civil jury's order that he compensate a woman who accused him of raping her.

title.children: Conor McGregor loses his appeal against civil rape case

image.altText: Waves crash into a sea wall off a beach dotted with palm trees

props.synopsis: It was one of the strongest tremors in recorded history, but Wednesday's megathrust earthquake brought less tsunami damage than feared. Here are some factors that may have been at play.

title.children: Why Russia's 'megathrust' earthquake didn't cause a bigger tsunami

image.altText: A composite image of close ups of Danielle Wood and Jim Chalmers.

props.synopsis: Small companies would pay less tax, but the largest could pay more under a new reform proposal from the independent agency tasked with helping to shape Labor's economic reform agenda.

title.children: Lower company tax rate, productivity agency tells Chalmers

image.altText: A charred wreckage of a car illuminated in bright orange and red flames on piles of building rubble

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian president has urged his allies to bring about "regime change" in Russia, hours after Moscow launched fresh drone and missile attacks on Kyiv, killing eight people including a six-year-old boy.

title.children: Zelenskyy calls for regime change in Russia as strikes on Kyiv continue

image.altText: A group of Bulldogs AFL players high-five as fans wave a giant Bulldogs banner in the stand.

props.synopsis: The Western Bulldogs deliver under the roof at Docklands as they smash the Giants for four quarters and roar into the top eight, leaving GWS in real strife.

title.children: Bulldogs roar into top eight, smashing Giants at Docklands

image.altText: Xavier Coates leaps

props.synopsis: The Melbourne Storm hang on to beat Parramatta Eels 16-10 in a low-scoring battle at Western Sydney Stadium.

title.children: Storm hang on to beat Eels after spectacular Coates score despite 'miracle' Eels try

image.altText: A large stick insect amongst green leaves

props.synopsis: Naturalists make the discovery in the misty rainforests of Far North Queensland, where tree canopies reach more than 30 metres above the ground and many species are believed to still be unknown.

title.children: Newly discovered giant stick insect could be Australia's heaviest

image.altText: A man in an NT Corrections uniform, holding a mesh spit hood.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory parliament has passed a suite of changes to the Youth Justice Act, including a proposal to reinstate the use of spit hoods on young people in youth detention centres.

title.children: Youth justice law changes pass NT parliament, reinstating spit hoods

image.altText: A photo of Muhammad's with back facing the camera, his mother holding him, inside a dark background.

props.synopsis: The image of a skeletal one-year-old Gazan boy wearing a bin-bag nappy and cradled in his mother's arms shocked the world, but questions around the child's underlying medical condition reveal the difficulty of telling stories inside Gaza.

title.children: Why this image of an emaciated Gazan boy sparked controversy

image.altText: A composite image of Dean Winter looking serious and David O'Byrne looking happy

props.synopsis: More seats have been confirmed as vote counting continues following the Tasmanian state election. Former Labor leader, now independent David O'Byrne has finished ahead of current leader Dean Winter, and Liberals Simon Behrakis and Nic Street have lost their seats.

title.children: Former Labor leader finishes ahead of current leader in Tasmanian election

image.altText: A black and white X logo with the words 'Happening Now' on a laptop and mobile phone screen

props.synopsis: The social media platform appealed an order requiring it to respond to demands from the office of the eSafety Commissioner that it explain how it was combating the sharing of child exploitation material.

title.children: Court rejects X appeal over notice to explain sharing of child abuse material

image.altText: An older man in a suit carries a book of papers as he approaches a podium, looking serious.

props.synopsis: Canada's move to join France and the United Kingdom by signalling it will recognise a Palestinian state reveals more about the highly coordinated international strategy on Gaza that now involves both Western and Arab nations.

title.children: A highly coordinated international strategy on Gaza is now unfolding

image.altText: Two cavoodles wearing a pilot and air hostess costume

props.synopsis: The airline has now received the green light from Food Standards Australia New Zealand, a major regulatory hurdle that stalled the rollout after Virgin first announced the plan last year.

title.children: Virgin Australia to allow pets on board before the end of the year

image.altText: A woman smiles and poses for a photo that has been overlayed with a sepia filter, adjusting the colour to give it a yellow tone

props.synopsis: A coroner finds no clear cause of death for 53-year-old Rachael Dixon, who died at a wellness retreat in regional Victoria.

title.children: Coroner finds woman died 'in the context' of taking magic mushrooms

image.altText: Missing Man Gach

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Police have covered 500 square kilometres of Central Australian desert terrain in search for a man who has been missing since Monday.

title.children: Police cover 500 sq km of outback terrain in search for missing 26yo man

image.altText: George on truck

props.synopsis: Lancaster bomber G for George carried 250 aircrew during World War II with no casualties. Now the iconic "lucky bomber" is returning to the Australian War Memorial.

title.children: Iconic WWII bomber 'G for George' returns home to Canberra

image.altText: Sealed containers stacked against a wall.

props.synopsis: Seven men have been found guilty in Fiji's largest-ever drug trial, which was closely watched by a public concerned over a growing meth scourge in the country.

title.children: Superyachts part of 'sophisticated' drug cartel trade in Fiji, judge finds

image.altText: Man in blue suit smiling

props.synopsis: Gareth Ward is expected to be stripped of his seat in parliament, his salary, and entitlements when the NSW government exercises a power for the first time in more than a century to expel him from the lower house.

title.children: Ward likely to be first MP in 100 years to be expelled from NSW parliament

image.altText: A blonde woman looking at the camera in a denim jacket

props.synopsis: Actor Sydney Sweeney's "good jeans" advertisement has sparked a debate about beauty standards and race.

title.children: Why an ad about Sydney Sweeney's 'great jeans' is facing backlash

image.altText: A woman in a grey jumper and her arms folded walks down stairs with her head low.

props.synopsis: A woman who secretly gave birth in the WA town of Geraldton before putting her newborn's body into a plastic bag is being sentenced in a Perth court. WARNING: This story contains distressing details.

title.children: WA mother whose newborn's body was found in freezer faces sentencing

image.altText: A man stands in the foreground with a picture of another man on a screen in the background.

props.synopsis: Police believe the missing remains of alleged murder victim Julian Story have been found by a member of the public, but say testing will be undertaken to confirm. Warning: This story contains content some readers may find distressing.

title.children: SA Police believe missing remains of Julian Story have been found

image.altText: Masumi Nakano wears a blue coat and white hat as he holds two brown bottles of sake.

props.synopsis: Japan increased sake exports as sales dipped domestically, but now Donald Trump's tariffs threaten to derail the drink's popularity and affordability in the key US market.

title.children: As sake suffers from a consumption crisis, brewers look to the US
